intro: Brassica chinensis var. crispa, commonly known as Chinese mustard or curled mustard, is a cultivar of the mustard plant characterized by its distinctive crinkled, curly leaves. It is an annual plant native to China and belongs to the Brassicaceae family. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lobed leaves that have a peppery flavor. It produces small yellow flowers that eventually develop into round, smooth pods containing edible seeds. This variety is often cultivated for both culinary and ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and flavor profile.
